column2: This individual will need to lead the category analysts and ensure continuous prioritization aligned to BU DX teams as well as identifying future GBS value realization opportunities ranging from productivity initiatives automation and expansion of services capabilities. Responsibilities Support DX Category Development & Perfect Store team team Be accountable to the DX LT and manage 7+ member team in GBS Ensuring his/her team delivers in an accurate and timely manner, services regarding; Category scorecarding & tracking Category periodic reviews & drivers of performance Category strategy development support Customer growth story creation support Category space & assortment analytics Perfect Store Execution scorecard & tracking Data utilisation & governance:  Work on Nielsen/Kantar etc and internal data sources, drive insights for category development, Perfect Store and sales teams. Implement safe guards and automate data quality checks, e.g., regular trend-watch of data streams to identify and address potential trend breaks Initiate the project discussion with stakeholders, understand & collect the project requirements and manage end to end execution of assortment & space and Perfect Store related projects. Advise and share relevant KPIs with actionable insights for reports and best practices with BU Category & Perfect Store team to enhance the Category & Execution analytics capability further. Collate and format consumer learnings from custom insight outputs, sales performance reporting, industry periodicals, etc to help inform and develop future category strategies & Pictures of Success Ensure collaboration across Category management and Perfect Store analysts to ensure complete feed-in to the channel Picture of Success development Provide responses to ad-hoc follow-ups when double-click (additional questions) required with tables/charts for relevant data Create powerpoint presentations to be used in explaining and clarifying difficult concepts and analytical insights Support relationships with the key end-user stakeholders in PepsiCo Europe Building Europe DX Commercial Sector objectives into GBS priorities (aligned with service catalogue) as part of the AOP process with clear KPIs across teams which can be tracked & reporting on as part of regular governance. Work with Design leads & Cluster Lead to scale up operation in line with capability needs/ requirements Responsible for managing multiple priorities; being able to manage deadlines and deliverables Lead communication with Business Partners and potentially end-users on matters such as available capacity, changes of scope of existing projects and planning of future projects Deliver outputs in line with the agreed timelines and formats while updating existing project management tools Flag and monitor any business risks related to delivering the requested outputs Partner with stakeholders and service center leadership to develop and finetune internal COE processes (work-flow mapping, pain-points and bottlenecks management) both related to service delivery and internal center operations Improve existing processes based on frequent Business Partner & end-user feedback loop People Responsibilities Lead and motivate team setting clear vision and objectives (aligned to Sector Objectives) & support driving a One Team Culture between Sector & GBS with clear ways of working. Ensure the People Planning Process is executed to high standards across the team with clear PDR setting, development conversations, talent review process, career developments & promotions / remuneration. Understand any route causes of attrition with ambition to keep  Ensure all new members are full onboarded understanding Europe Commercial Sector, the capabilities, the job role, the team members (both in GBS & Sector) to set them up for success.  Facilitate smooth transition of processes to team (future scope could also include other support functions) Organize weekly/monthly/quarterly reviews for subordinate team leads to ensure continuous improvement in efficiency, effectiveness and overall integration of the work with markets. Qualifications An experienced Insight or Analytics professional with experience in a leading consumer goods company with 10+ years and atleast 2+ years of leadership experience Education: MBA, Masters or bachelors in engineering/economics, statistics, marketing. Language: English Fluent High degree of familiarity with CPG and Food & Beverage industry data sources, including Nielsen/IRi (POS and HH panel), Kantar Worldpanel, etc. Deep understanding of CPG industry business performance outputs and causal measures, their relationships, and how to address business questions in a robust way that translates to simple outputs Proficient with Power Point and advance Excel skills. Willingness to learn new tools and capabilities. Strong collaborator: Interested and motivated by working with others. Actively creates and participates in opportunities to co-create solutions across markets; will be willing and able to embrace Responsive Ways of Working Can easily see how insights/research learning can improve businesses impact and frames up presentation efforts and opportunities to inform business decisions Proven analytics, shopper research experience, or consumer insights experience applying statistics to CPG industry business problems Operational experience from business servicing sector and/or consulting experience would be a plus Essential : Become an indispensable partner for Sector Commercial by showing great thought leadership with ability to recognize and take actions to improve delivery of work. Not always being asked.  Navigating conflict in a collaborative way to provide a solution that works for GBS & Sector.  High degree of organizational savvy Solution-oriented approach to problem solving Ability to challenge requests in a constructive way that does not damage relationships or slow progress Depth and breadth of syndicated data analytics and statistical modeling Complete understanding of internal & external data sources that could contribute to analytics roles across service centers Strong analytical thinking with proven ability to connect data & insight from category consumption, brands drivers, macro & micro trends, and future forces of consumer change and deliver clear implications for the business.
column11: Category Management, marketing, data analytics, advanced excel, statistical modeling, consumer insights

column2: Type: Full-time Association, 6 days working   Role Overview:  As a Librarian, you will be the guardian of our digital treasure trove, entrusted with the sacred task of curating and managing the listings and collections on our website. Your keen eye for organisation, coupled with your deep understanding of genres and bestsellers, will guide readers and buyers on their journey through the vast expanse of our literary landscape.  What would you do?   Mastering Listings: With the precision of a master archivist, you will categorise and list books according to their genres, ensuring that readers can easily navigate our digital shelves and discover the stories that resonate with their hearts.   Home-page 'Shelves': Like a skilled decorator arranging a grand library, you will craft enchanting shelves on our homepage, showcasing curated collections that capture the essence of our most beloved tales. Through your artistry, you will invite visitors to embark on a journey through the wonders of literature with every click.   Crafting Collections: Drawing upon your intuition and insight, you will arrange books according to their bestselling status, guiding readers towards the treasures that have captured the hearts and minds of countless souls.  You are someone with:   1-3 years of experience in librarianship or a related field, with a proven track record of organising and managing digital collections.   A meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to excellence, ensuring that every book finds its rightful place in our digital library.   Professional knowledge of MS Office and Google Workspace, allowing you to wield the tools of modern librarianship with finesse and efficiency.   An in-depth understanding of genres, types of books, and the ever-shifting currents of literary trends, empowering you to curate collections that resonate with our readers
column11: Listing, Library Management, Digital Library, google workspace

column2: The Role: We're seeking a dynamic Catalogue Manager to spearhead the strategic management of our product listings across leading eCommerce marketplaces. You'll have the autonomy to design and execute initiatives that directly impact revenue, visibility, and market share. This role demands a blend of analytical prowess, eCommerce expertise, and a passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences. Key Responsibilities: Marketplace Mastery:  Develop and execute strategies to achieve ambitious revenue targets on platforms like Flipkart and Amazon. This involves optimizing pricing, leveraging platform-specific promotions, and ensuring our products always stand out. Data-Driven Decision Making:  Immerse yourself in sales data to identify patterns, opportunities, and areas for improvement. Translate your findings into actionable strategies that consistently drive sales growth. Strategic Advertising:  Manage PLA (Product Listing Ads) and AMS (Amazon Marketing Services) campaigns to maximize product visibility and drive conversions across key platforms. Competitive Intelligence:  Stay ahead of the curve by monitoring competitor strategies, pricing, and promotions. Adapt our approach to maintain a competitive edge. Cross-Functional Collaboration:  Build strong partnerships with teams across marketing, operations, and merchandising to ensure seamless listing management, pricing accuracy, and consistent buy-box dominance. Evolving with eCommerce:  Demonstrate a thirst for knowledge about the ever-changing eCommerce landscape, proactively identifying new trends and opportunities to capitalize on. Reconciliation Expertise (Bonus):  Experience in e-commerce reconciliation will be a significant advantage. Desired Candidate Profile: MBA Preferred:  An MBA in Marketing demonstrates a commitment to understanding the fundamentals of business and consumer behavior. eCommerce Experience:  A minimum of 8-12 years of hands-on experience within the eCommerce sector, ideally in a catalogue or merchandising related capacity. Excel Proficiency:  Advanced Excel skills are a must for slicing and dicing data to uncover insights and support decision-making. Exceptional Communicator:  Possess outstanding written, verbal, presentation, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders and champion your ideas. Analytical Mindset:  Naturally inclined to analyze data, pinpoint trends, and translate your findings into actionable recommendations and strategies. Proactive Problem-Solver:  You thrive on tackling challenges head-on, finding creative solutions, and optimizing processes. Team Player:  Ability to build trust and rapport across the organization, influencing key stakeholders to achieve shared goals. Results-Oriented Achiever:  A track record of not just meeting, but exceeding targets, fueled by a results-driven mindset and a tenacious work ethic. Why This Role Is Unique: This is your opportunity to directly shape the success of our company in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. If you thrive on data-driven decision-making, possess an entrepreneurial spirit, and strive to make a tangible impact on the business, this role is for you.
column11: Catalog, industry knowledge, Sales analysis, Ecommerce, Catalog Management, Management, Stakeholder management, MBA, Revenue targets, strategic thinking, ONIX understanding, Excel, Competitor analysis, Analytical, Strategy, Amazon, Problem-solving, Advertising, Communication

column2: About the Role: We are seeking a driven and results-oriented Category Manager/ Associate to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall success of our categories on antmascot.com. You will oversee a variety of tasks, including strategic planning, vendor management, inventory control, and driving category profitability. Responsibilities: Strategic Planning & Analysis: Define Minimum Order Quantities (MOQs) for products. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as topline and bottom-line performance, stock availability, stock turnover, and category assortment. Analyze market trends to identify opportunities for category expansion. Category Operations Management: Manage all aspects of category operations, including buying & merchandising, vendor management, demand planning, and inventory control. Develop and implement category range plans, promotional strategies, and planograms. Track and improve Average Basket Value (ABV), bill penetration, and vendor fill rates. Merchandising & Vendor Management: Lead merchandising efforts aligned with overall business objectives. Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors and suppliers. Negotiate favorable terms and pricing (Total Ownership Cost - TOC) for products. Proactively negotiate supplier schemes and promotions for cost optimization. Inventory Management: Implement strategies to control inventory levels and reduce slow-moving products. Introduce and promote fast-moving products to optimize stock turnover. Manage liquidation plans for outdated or slow-moving inventory. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in any discipline (Master's degree preferred). Minimum 3-5 years of experience in category management. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Experience with inventory management systems (IMS) a plus. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. A passion for the B2B & E-commerce industry and a strong understanding of Categories. Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and growing company. Be part of a passionate team dedicated to providing exceptional customer service. Contribute to the success of a leading B2B platform.
column11: Category Management, Merchandising Strategies, Inventory Management, Strategic Procurement, Vendor Management, New Vendor Development, RFQS, Negotiation, Procurement Planning, Buyer Activities, Procurement Management

column2: BricknBolt is a managed marketplace providing construction services. We are category creators and front-runners in space. We are solving one of the most complex business problems and creating an ecosystem of trust for the Stakeholders - Customers, Construction professionals, and Material vendors. Construction has been a highly unorganized and severely tech-deficit industry globally. We are just not trying to organize but disrupt the industry completely using technology and process - creating the playbook for the industry.  Indian real estate is earmarked to be a $650 billion market in 2025 and a $1 trillion worth sector in 2030. With 85%+ construction still unorganized in India, Brick&Bolt is on a path to capture the massive and super-broken market using our technology and processes.  Expanding to more than 12 cities in 15 months. With the Series A2 round, Brick&Bolt has raised a total of $16 million. Earlier Sequoia Surge, Fundamental, HDFC Capital Advisors Limited and Stride Ventures have invested in Brick&Bolt. In Jan 2023, we raised Series A2 Funding of $10million from Accel and Celesta Capital. About the Role:- You will be in charge of leading Brick&Bolt's, Category of Material Management for Pan India. We're looking for someone who thrives in the very early stages of a company and is self-motivated, multi-tasker, and a demonstrated team-player. Responsibilities:  Planning and developing the product range and finalizing the pricing strategy for products for NCR  End to end responsibility for new category/product development and new category/product launches and strengthening the current product portfolio.  Responsible for developing, implementing, managing and reporting on plans to improve site metrics by increasing conversion of sellers onboarding.  Involve in negotiation all vendor buying agreements between the company and respective suppliers  Work closely with Suppliers, majorly Brands and engage them in Joint Business Plans with a promise of growth and scale  Responsible for topline and bottom line (P&L), product returns and inventory mix  Leading negotiations, making deals & maintaining strong relationships with vendors to enhance competitive positioning including sales programs and promotional support.  Maintaining control over proper stock levels and Preparing buying plans and sales forecasts. Skills :  Experience in Building Material Management is a must.  Results-driven and able to work with cross-functional teams to achieve sales goals  Passion to work in an entrepreneurial and high growth environment  Strong business acumen & strategic thinking  Must be highly organized, has insight of commercial thinking, with exceptional communication skills
column11: Building Materials, Vendor Development, Vendor Negotiation, Construction Material, Supply Chain Management, Negotiation, Purchase Planning, Purchase Management, Vendor Relations, Sourcing / Procurement, Vendor Relationship Management
